hippocorpus.BriefDescription: A dataset of 6,854 English diary-like short stories about recalled and imagined events

ColumnInfo.WorkTimeInSeconds: Time in seconds that it took the worker to do the entire HIT (reading instructions, storywriting, questions)
ColumnInfo.WorkerId: Unique ID of the worker (random string, not MTurk worker ID)
ColumnInfo.annotatorAge: Lower limit of the age bucket of the worker. Buckets are: 18-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55+
ColumnInfo.distracted: How distracted were you while writing your story? (5-point Likert)
ColumnInfo.draining: How taxing/draining was writing for you emotionally? (5-point Likert)
ColumnInfo.frequency: How often do you think about or talk about this event? (5-point Likert)
ColumnInfo.importance: How impactful, important, or personal is this story/this event to you? (5-point Likert)
ColumnInfo.logTimeSinceEvent: Log of time (days) since the recalled event happened
ColumnInfo.mainEvent: Short phrase describing the main event described
ColumnInfo.mostSurprising: Short phrase describing what the most surpring aspect of the story was
ColumnInfo.openness: Continuous variable representing the openness to experience of the worker
ColumnInfo.recAgnPairId: ID of the recalled story that corresponds to this retold story (null for imagined stories). Group on this variable to get the recalled-retold pairs.
ColumnInfo.recImgPairId: ID of the recalled story that corresponds to this imagined story (null for retold stories). Group on this variable to get the recalled-imagined pairs.
ColumnInfo.similarity: How similar to your life does this event/story feel to you? (5-point Likert)
ColumnInfo.story: Story about the imagined or recalled event (15-25 sentences)
ColumnInfo.stressful: How stressful was this writing task? (5-point Likert)
ColumnInfo.summary: Summary of the events in the story (1-3 sentences)
ColumnInfo.timeSinceEvent: Time (num. days) since the recalled event happened

thoughtpings.BriefDescription: An ecological momentary assessment of freely-moving and task-unrelated thoughts. Participants were 'pinged' via text message to answer probes throughout the day.

ColumnInfo.day: D1, D2, D3, D4, or D5
ColumnInfo.off_task: (Y)es or (N)o, participant reporting if they were involved in a task or not
ColumnInfo.wandering: Likert scale 1-6, participant reporting how much they were mind-wandering

dreamviews.BriefDescription: Scraped on October 9th, 2021. This is all the uncleaned dream reports.
